Items.Title: Move cube
Items.Description: - In the prepared code, in curly braces, write MoveCube(); (with a semicolon, this is important!).

Items.Title: Write Hello World!
Items.Description: - You need to call the WriteLine() method of the Computer(Computer.WriteLine) class and pass the Hello World!

Items.Title: Door opening
Items.Description:
- Declare a keyNumber variable of type int with value 55. The variable is declared like this:
 type name = value;

Items.Title: Take corm
Items.Description:
- Correct a typo in the code to take a package of food by weight in kilograms.
You need to take a box weighing 0.5 kg.
When a variable is declared with the var keyword, its type is determined automatically, based on the data assigned during initialization.
When an integer is divided by integer, the result is an integer without a remainder
5-integer
5.0f, a fractional number (of type float)
5.0 a fractional number (of type double)

Items.Title: How many days will the food last
Items.Description:
- n this task, you have to calculate how many days (not counting today) you will have enough food, provided that you feed the fish today.
The method is passed the number of fish of 2 types, the daily norm for them is the amount of food. You need to return the number of days the feed will last (excluding today's feed).
 To convert double to int when assigning or passing to a method, precede the value with (int)

Items.Title: Count the number of glasses
Items.Description:
- You need to count the number of glasses needed to cook the dish.
 You are given the required volumes of flour and water, as well as the volume of the glass.
To round up, use the Math.Floor() method.

Items.Title: Add/reduce temperature
Items.Description:
- You need to implement two methods to add and subtract the temperature.
 You can do this by manipulating the T variable.
 Consider that the variable is already declared outside of the method (we'll discuss how to do this later).

Items.Title: Sharing or not
Items.Description:
- You need to determine whether the transferred sum is divisible by 4 and return the remainder of the division (if the remainder is 0).
 Division with remainder: divisible% quotient
